WorkItem.ClosedComment:
As part of our move to GitHub, we're closing our CodePlex suggestions and asking that people move them to the GitHub issue tracker for further discussion.  Some feature requests may already be active on GitHub, so please make sure to look for an existing issue before filing a new one.

You can find our GitHub issue tracker here:
https://github.com/microsoft/typeScript/issues
WorkItem.Description: Just through a compiler warning if I try to inherit from a sealed / final class.

Comments.Message: I may request as well this be allowed to be added to interface types.  It would solve a bunch of possible issues (see use case link above).
Hello, I would like to use a "sealed" keyword also for instance methods, indicating that they shouldn't be (and cannot be) overridden, similarly to C# implementation.
